name: Night Bike Parkcade - Toronto Games Week

location.name: secret location! (check our site to find it)

description:
This year, our legendary Night Parkcade -- a pop up arcade at a park after dark! -- has a special two-wheeled theme! Dress your bike up in lights and pedal on over (or hotfoot it from a subway stop) and enjoy a number of bike-related videogames like the protest game Loser Lane. Only TGW subscribers get the mysterious scroll of invitation that will lead them to the location.

Toronto Video Game Month is set to bring the world of gaming to life! From adrenaline-pumping esports tournaments to massive outdoor games played under the open sky, this event is designed for all—from hardcore gamers to the game-curious. Immerse yourself in interactive experiences, discover the talent of Toronto’s local indie developers, and engage with major studio activations. Plus, tap into the industry at a prestigious video game conference, thought-provoking workshops, and expert talks on the future of gaming. It’s a month to discover, play, and connect with Toronto’s thriving gaming community!

name: Games Made Open - Toronto Games Week
description:
Interested in open source game engines and hardware? Come down to the TTLMakerspace for a day of hands-on hacking and learning about free open-source tools like Godot and Blender. Create and flash your own game on a Gameboy cartridge with GBStudio, an open source program! Play laser-cut mini arcade cabinets!

name: Art Wellness Workshop
description: Experience the healing power of creativity. Relieve stress, build confidence, and explore self-expression through guided art activities. No experience needed, just an open mind. Relax, create, and connect in a supportive safe space.

name: Radio Controlled Boating on the Lake
description: A demonstration of radio controlled boating.

name: Dream Game Incorporated - Toronto Games Week
description:
A playful, family friendly event where participants doodle and draw based on silly prompts before having their art immediately scanned and included as assets in a playable game prototype. Pro game artists will be on hand to chat and give advice to participants interested in that pathway as a career.

name: Play House - Toronto Games Week
description:
A series of playful performances that will B fusing live music and games to X-press Y we create. Have a dance dance to some electronic or pick up the controller and have a frolic. The SELECT is eclect as we START some new art. D-PAD is SeeScape, up the flight of stairs, and micro-transactions at the door go to charity.

name: A Standup Comedy Special that's ONLY about Dating
description:
Everything Wrong with Dating is a night of unhinged jokes about dating apps, alpha bros, and relationship delusion.

Crowd work at the end, please communicate in advance if you would like to avoid being noticed.

name: Indie Game Emporium - Toronto Games Week
description:
A congregation of local DIY developers offering their artisanal videogame products. Meet the indies making eclectic games (in your area!) and buy their wares without the separation of screens, distribution platforms, and algorithms which rule the land of computer entertainment on The Net.

name: NextGen Showcase - Toronto Games Week
description:
Returning in its third year! NextGen Showcase is a curated showcase, handpicked by an esteemed curator, featuring games crafted by emerging talents in Toronto's vibrant game development scene. Immerse yourself in an evening of extraordinary gaming experiences from the future talents of the Toronto game dev scene, accompanied by delectable appetizers. Supported by Unreal and AMD.

name: Metazooa Live! - Toronto Games Week
description:
Come explore High Park in an evolution-themed scavenger hunt where you'll track down plants and animals with your phone, build your own tree of life, and win prizes just for being curious about nature! Transform your understanding of biodiversity while exploring one of Toronto's most beautiful parks!

name: Out of Bounds 2ronto - Toronto Games Week
description:
Out of Bounds 2ronto is Lady Arcaders' second annual in-person women & femme speedrunning event! Folks will play games as quickly as possible, showing off their talents and challenging themselves! The event will also be broadcast online to our Twitch channel. EVERYONE is welcome to join the fun!

name: Community Environment Day at Loretto College
description:
Join Councillor Bravo (Ward 9) and the City of Toronto to help reduce the amount of waste going to landfill. Drop off household items for donation, electronics for reuse or recycling and household hazardous waste for proper disposal. 

Pick up free bagged compost while supplies last and kitchen catchers for organics ($7 each – cash, debit and credit accepted).

name: Resistance and Reconciliation Walking Tour

location.name: Start Point - David Crombie Park Basketball Court, West Side

description:
Explore the histories, experiences, and ongoing contributions of Indigenous Peoples in Toronto. Through visits to public art installations, learn about Indigenous life before colonization, the impacts of the Indian Act and residential schools, and the legacy of activism. The tour also highlights the ways Indigenous communities are creating space and visibility in the modern city. By focusing on local artists and storytellers, this tour demonstrates how art can be a powerful tool for both resistance and reconciliation. Participants are encouraged to reflect on their own relationships to the land, history, and community.

This 1.6 kilometre-long tour was developed and will be led by Mike Buckland.

name: It Takes a Village Walking Tour
description:
Discover the stories of Toronto - 2SLGBTQ+ community — from advocacy fuelled by the Bathhouse Raids and the AIDS epidemic, to the belonging and celebration found at the City Park Apartments, Buddies in Bad Times Theatre and St. Charles Tavern. Learn about efforts to strengthen the Church-Wellesley Village today and build the community for the future.

This 2.0 kilometre-long tour was developed and will be led by Erin Verdon. Erin is a former Emerging Historian with Heritage Toronto and has been involved in museum and heritage work for the past ten years. Currently, she works as a Conservation Educator where she helps communities connect with their local natural heritage.

name: Open House, Open Hearts: A Pride Month Self-Guided Experience at Spadina Museum
description: Do you want to learn more about Queer Toronto history? Take advantage of this special one-day opportunity to forgo formal tours and explore the house at your own pace. Guides will be stationed throughout to share Toronto 2SLGBTQIA+ histories. While telling the story of the Austin family in the 1920s and 30s who lived in the magnificent house atop the hill, the museum will also showcase the lives of Queer people who lived in Toronto during the same period. A showcase of dresses and artefacts from Michelle DuBarry, one of Canada’s oldest drag queens, will also be on display.

name: Serenata Cinematica
description:
Under the direction of Artistic Director Daniele Colle, Coro San Marco returns with a captivating new program celebrating music from the movies. This concert features timeless film themes by acclaimed composers Ennio Morricone, Nino Rota, John Williams and many others, brought to life by the choir and soloists while movie scenes are projected as a backdrop to the performances. The choir will be accompanied by pianist Adolfo De Santis and violinist Carina Sandejas.

During the concert, Coro San Marco will award scholarships to young musicians who will pursue their music studies at a Canadian university.
